artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Kiya Sōjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 117; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 18–19 no. 18, p. 298.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheets; giant demon at center, with wrinkled ghoulish face with bulging eyes and gaping mouth, and bare arms, reaching down twoard group of men in armor armed with swords at left, right, and center, with one man beheath demon's PR arm, near demon's face; women and smaller ghouls at left and right running away; grey-green ground
dimension: 14 1/2 × 10 in. (36.83 × 25.4 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Carver’s seal R: 彫工小泉兼 {horikō Koizumi Kane} | C: 彫子兼 {hori Kokane} | L: 彫兼 {hori Kane} |  Censor seal: 子十改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 一魁斎芳年画 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi ga}
text: From right to left: Ukyō Gon-no-daibu Fujiwara Yasumasa, Takiguchi Utoneri Watanabe Tsuna, Kageyu Jikan Urabe Suetake (R); Sesshū Ason Minamoto Yorimitsu, Yugei-no-jō Usui Sadamitsu (C); Shume Sakata Kintoki. R: 右京権大夫藤原保昌, 滝口内舎人渡辺綱, 勘解由次官卜部季武; C: 摂州朝臣源頼光, 靱屓尉碓井定光; L: 主馬佐酒田公時.
title: Picture of Raikō and his Four Companions Conquering the Demon of Mount Ōe
